logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: The White Horse of Uffington

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The cutting of huge figures or ‘geoglyphs’ into the earth of English hillsides...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A large design or motif produced on the ground by durable elements of the landscape, such as stones, gravel, or earth
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các hình vẽ trên mặt đất

phase3Production.content: The Nazca Lines in Peru are the most famous geoglyphs in the world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...into the earth of English hillsides has taken place for more than 3,000 years.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The sloping side of a hill

phase3Production.content: The village is built on a steep hillside overlooking the sea.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There are 56 hill figures scattered around England...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Large visual representations created by cutting into a hillside to reveal the underlying geology

phase3Production.content: The Cerne Abbas Giant is a famous chalk hill figure in Dorset.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...hill figures scattered around England...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be found in different places across an area

phase3Production.content: Ancient ruins are scattered around the Greek countryside.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...on the chalk downlands of the country’s southern counties.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Areas of open, rolling, grassy land on hills made of chalk

phase3Production.content: The chalk downlands of southern England are known for their unique flora and fauna.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The figures include giants, horses, crosses and regimental badges.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The official emblems or symbols of an army regiment

phase3Production.content: The soldier proudly wore the regimental badge on his uniform.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Although the majority of these geoglyphs date within the last 300 years or so...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có 'niên đại' (date) 'trong vòng' (within) '300 năm qua' (the last 300 years)

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /deɪt wɪˈðɪn ðə lɑːst θriː ˈhʌndrəd jɪəz/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have originated in the period covering the most recent 300 years
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có niên đại trong vòng 300 năm qua

phase3Production.content: Most buildings in this part of the city date within the last 100 years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The most famous of these figures is perhaps also the most mysterious – the Uffington White Horse...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Difficult or impossible to understand, explain, or identify

phase3Production.content: She received a mysterious letter with no return address.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The White Horse has recently been re-dated and shown to be even older...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have its age or date of origin determined again, often with new evidence or methods
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được xác định lại niên đại

phase3Production.content: Using new technology, the fossil was re-dated and found to be much younger.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...older than its previously assigned ancient pre-Roman Iron Age* date.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The historical period that was attributed to it in the past
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Niên đại được gán trước đây

phase3Production.content: The painting's previously assigned date was proven incorrect by modern analysis.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: More controversial is the date of the enigmatic Long Man of Wilmington in Sussex.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Giving rise or likely to give rise to public disagreement

phase3Production.content: The government's new tax policy is highly controversial.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the date of the enigmatic Long Man of Wilmington in Sussex.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Difficult to interpret or understand; mysterious

phase3Production.content: He left an enigmatic message on her voicemail before he disappeared.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: While many historians are convinced the figure is prehistoric, others believe...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hình vẽ này thuộc 'thời tiền sử' (prehistoric)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Relating to the period before written records

phase3Production.content: Stonehenge is a famous prehistoric monument in England.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...was simply to remove the overlying grass to reveal the gleaming white chalk below.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The layer of grass that covers the surface of the ground

phase3Production.content: The archaeologists carefully removed the overlying grass to expose the ancient stones.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to reveal the gleaming white chalk below.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Chalk (a type of soft white limestone) that shines brightly

phase3Production.content: The cliffs were made of gleaming white chalk that reflected the sunlight.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...unless it was regularly cleaned or scoured by a fairly large team of people.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'làm sạch' (cleaned) hoặc 'cọ rửa' (scoured) 'một cách thường xuyên' (regularly)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be cleaned or rubbed hard to remove dirt on a frequent basis
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được dọn dẹp hoặc cọ rửa thường xuyên

phase3Production.content: The ancient monument had to be regularly scoured to keep the chalk visible.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...when the traditions associated with the figures faded, people no longer bothered...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: When customs or beliefs gradually disappeared or became less strong
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các truyền thống đã phai nhạt

phase3Production.content: As the years went by, many of the old traditions faded and were forgotten.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...people no longer bothered or remembered to clear away the grass...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mọi người 'không còn' (no longer) 'bận tâm' (bothered) nữa

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To stop making the effort to do something

phase3Production.content: After the factory closed, people no longer bothered to maintain the old road.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to clear away the grass to expose the chalk outline.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make the shape or boundary made of chalk visible by removing what is covering it
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm lộ ra đường viền đá phấn

phase3Production.content: Workers cleared the dirt to expose the chalk outline of the ancient figure.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is a testament to the strength and continuity of local customs and beliefs...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Là một 'minh chứng cho' (testament to) 'sức mạnh' (the strength)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Serving as clear proof or evidence of the power and endurance of something

phase3Production.content: The survival of the old building is a testament to the quality of its construction.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the strength and continuity of local customs and beliefs...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sự liên tục/kế thừa' (continuity) 'của các phong tục' (of local customs) 'địa phương' (local)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The fact that local traditions have continued to exist over a long period of time without being changed or stopped
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự liên tục của các phong tục địa phương

phase3Production.content: The annual festival ensures the continuity of local customs for future generations.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...which, in one case at least, must stretch back over millennia.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Phải 'kéo dài' (stretch back) 'hơn hàng ngàn năm' (over millennia)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have a history or duration that extends for thousands of years into the past
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Kéo dài hơn hàng thiên niên kỷ

phase3Production.content: The traditions of this tribe stretch back over millennia.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The Uffington White Horse is a unique, stylised representation of a horse...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'sự thể hiện/miêu tả' (representation) 'được cách điệu hóa' (stylised)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A depiction of something in a non-realistic, simplified, or conventional artistic style

phase3Production.content: The company's logo is a stylised representation of a bird in flight.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...consisting of a long, sleek back, thin disjointed legs, a streaming tail...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Legs that appear to be disconnected or not joined together smoothly

phase3Production.content: The ancient drawing showed a strange animal with thin, disjointed legs.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and a bird-like beaked head.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A head that has a hard, projecting mouth part, similar to that of a bird

phase3Production.content: The mythical griffin is often depicted with the body of a lion and the beaked head of an eagle.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The elegant creature almost melts into the landscape.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A graceful and stylishly beautiful animal or being

phase3Production.content: The swan is an elegant creature, known for its long, curved neck.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The elegant creature almost melts into the landscape.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Gần như 'hòa tan/hòa mình vào' (melts into) 'phong cảnh' (the landscape)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To blend with the surroundings so well that it is hard to see separately

phase3Production.content: The chameleon's camouflage is so effective that it almost melts into the landscape.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...surrounded by Bronze Age burial mounds.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Hills or piles of earth built over a grave or graves

phase3Production.content: Ancient burial mounds are often protected as important archaeological sites.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to make it extremely difficult to see from close quarters...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhìn 'từ cự ly gần' (from close quarters)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: From a short distance away

phase3Production.content: The huge painting is impressive from a distance, but confusing when viewed from close quarters.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...many geoglyphs is best appreciated from the air.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'chiêm ngưỡng/thưởng thức' (appreciated) 'tốt nhất' (best) 'từ trên không' (from the air)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be understood or enjoyed most fully when seen from above
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được thưởng ngoạn tốt nhất từ trên không

phase3Production.content: The true scale of the Nazca lines can only be best appreciated from the air.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...an adequate impression may be gained.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có thể có được 'một ấn tượng' (an impression) 'đầy đủ/tương xứng' (adequate)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A satisfactory or acceptable idea, feeling, or opinion about what something is like

phase3Production.content: It's hard to get an adequate impression of the Grand Canyon from photographs alone.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The earliest evidence of a horse at Uffington is from the 1070s CE...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The first or oldest proof that something existed or happened

phase3Production.content: The earliest evidence of human settlement in the area dates back 5,000 years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and the first reference to the horse itself is soon after, in 1190 CE.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The first time it is mentioned in writing
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự đề cập đầu tiên đến con ngựa

phase3Production.content: The first reference to the city in historical texts is from the Roman period.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: However, the carving is believed to date back much further than that.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có 'niên đại' (date back) 'xa hơn nhiều' (much further)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have existed since a time long before a particular point in the past
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có niên đại xa hơn nhiều

phase3Production.content: The castle's foundations are thought to date back much further than the visible walls.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Due to the similarity of the Uffington White Horse to the stylised depictions of horses on 1st century BCE coins...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'sự miêu tả' (depictions) 'cách điệu' (stylised) 'về loài ngựa' (of horses)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Artistic representations of horses in a non-realistic or conventional style
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các miêu tả cách điệu về ngựa

phase3Production.content: Ancient Greek vases often feature stylised depictions of athletes and gods.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: However, in 1995 Optically Stimulated Luminescence (OSL) testing was carried out...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Phương pháp 'xét nghiệm/định tuổi' (testing) 'bằng phát quang kích thích quang học' (Optically Stimulated Luminescence - OSL)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A dating method used to determine how long ago minerals were last exposed to sunlight or sufficient heating
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Xét nghiệm phát quang kích thích quang học

phase3Production.content: Optically Stimulated Luminescence (OSL) testing helped to date the ancient pottery accurately.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...testing was carried out by the Oxford Archaeological Unit on soil...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be performed or conducted by a particular person or group

phase3Production.content: The experiment was carried out by a team of leading scientists.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...on soil from two of the lower layers of the horse’s body...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hai trong số 'các lớp' (layers) 'thấp hơn/bên dưới' (lower)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The strata or levels that are underneath others

phase3Production.content: Archaeologists found older artifacts in the lower layers of the excavation site.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The result was a date for the horse’s construction somewhere between 1400 and 600 BCE...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'niên đại' (date) 'cho việc xây dựng' (for the construction) 'con ngựa' (the horse's)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The historical time period when the horse figure was created
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Niên đại xây dựng của con ngựa

phase3Production.content: Scientists have finally established a reliable date for the monument's construction.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The latter end of this date range would tie the carving of the horse in with occupation of the nearby Uffington hillfort...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sẽ 'liên kết' (tie... in with) 'việc chạm khắc' (the carving) 'với' (with) 'việc chiếm đóng' (occupation)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To connect or associate the creation of the carving with another event or period
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Gắn/liên kết việc chạm khắc với

phase3Production.content: The discovery of Roman coins helps to tie the settlement in with the period of Roman rule.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...indicating that it may represent a tribal emblem marking the land of the inhabitants of the hillfort.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The people who lived in the fortified settlement on the hill
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cư dân của pháo đài trên đồi

phase3Production.content: The ancient inhabitants of the hillfort were skilled warriors.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it may represent a tribal emblem marking the land...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A symbol or design that represents a particular tribe or social group

phase3Production.content: The eagle was a powerful tribal emblem for many Native American groups.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Alternatively, the carving may have been carried out during a Bronze or Iron Age ritual.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'nghi lễ' (ritual) 'thời kỳ Đồ Sắt' (Iron Age)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A religious or solemn ceremony from the historical period characterized by the use of iron tools

phase3Production.content: Archaeologists believe the stone circle was used for an ancient Iron Age ritual.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the Celtic*** horse goddess Epona, who was worshipped as a protector of horses...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Vị 'thần bảo hộ' (protector) 'của loài ngựa' (of horses)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A deity or figure who is believed to guard and keep horses safe
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vị thần bảo hộ loài ngựa

phase3Production.content: Saint Francis is considered the protector of animals in some traditions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and for her associations with fertility.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Và vì 'sự liên quan' (associations) 'của bà' (her) 'với' (with) 'sự sinh sản/màu mỡ' (fertility)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The connections or links that something has with the ability to produce young or new growth
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự liên quan đến khả năng sinh sản

phase3Production.content: In many ancient cultures, the snake had strong associations with fertility and rebirth.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: However, the cult of Epona was not imported from Gaul (France) until around the first century CE.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A system of religious veneration and devotion directed towards the particular figure of Epona

phase3Production.content: The cult of Isis spread from Egypt throughout the Roman Empire.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This date is at least six centuries after the Uffington Horse was probably carved.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Ít nhất' (at least) 'sáu thế kỷ sau' (six centuries after)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A minimum of 600 years later than a particular event
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ít nhất sáu thế kỷ sau

phase3Production.content: The castle was rebuilt at least two centuries after the original structure was destroyed.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Nevertheless, the horse had great ritual and economic significance during the Bronze and Iron Ages...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The importance of something in relation to trade, wealth, and the economy
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tầm quan trọng về kinh tế

phase3Production.content: The new port will have huge economic significance for the entire region.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as attested by its depictions on jewellery and other metal objects.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Như được chứng thực bởi' (as attested by)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: As shown or proven by evidence from something

phase3Production.content: The king's great wealth, as attested by the treasures in his tomb, was legendary.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It is possible that the carving represents a goddess in native mythology, such as Rhiannon...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The traditional stories and beliefs of the original people of a particular country or region

phase3Production.content: Many characters from native mythology are associated with features of the landscape.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The fact that geoglyphs can disappear easily, along with their associated rituals and meaning...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có thể 'biến mất' (disappear) 'một cách dễ dàng' (easily)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To vanish or cease to be visible without difficulty

phase3Production.content: Without regular maintenance, the chalk figure would disappear easily under the grass.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...along with their associated rituals and meaning...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The ceremonies or series of actions that are connected with something

phase3Production.content: The festival and its associated rituals have been performed for centuries.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...indicates that they were never intended to be anything more than temporary gestures.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chúng 'chưa bao giờ' (never) 'được dự định' (intended to be) 'là' (be)..

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have never had the purpose or plan of being something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chưa bao giờ có ý định là

phase3Production.content: The building was never intended to be a permanent structure.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...anything more than temporary gestures.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Actions or expressions that are meant to last for only a limited period of time
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những cử chỉ/hành động tạm thời

phase3Production.content: The flowers were a nice, but temporary, gesture of friendship.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But this does not lessen their importance.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Không 'làm giảm' (lessen) 'tầm quan trọng' (their importance) 'của chúng' (their)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make their significance or value smaller or weaker
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm giảm tầm quan trọng của chúng

phase3Production.content: The fact that the painting is a copy does not lessen its beauty.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: These giant carvings are a fascinating glimpse into the minds of their creators...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A brief but interesting insight into something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một cái nhìn thoáng qua đầy hấp dẫn về

phase3Production.content: Old letters provide a fascinating glimpse into the lives of people in the past.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a fascinating glimpse into the minds of their creators...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Tâm trí' (the minds) 'của' (of) 'những người tạo ra chúng' (their creators)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The thoughts, intentions, and beliefs of the people who made them
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tâm trí của những người tạo ra chúng

phase3Production.content: We can only guess at what was in the minds of their creators when they built this monument.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and how they viewed the landscape in which they lived.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: How they saw or thought about the natural environment around them

phase3Production.content: The artist viewed the landscape not just as scenery, but as a source of spiritual power.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: *Iron Age: a period (in Britain 800 BCE – 43 CE) that is characterised by the use of iron tools

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The period following the Bronze Age, characterized by the use of iron tools and weapons

phase3Production.content: Many hillforts in Britain were built during the Iron Age.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that is characterised by the use of iron tools

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be a typical or noticeable feature of something or someone

phase3Production.content: The Victorian era was characterised by rapid industrialization and social change.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: **Bronze Age: a period (in Britain c. 2,500 BCE – 800 BCE) that is characterised by the development of bronze tools

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The period following the Stone Age, characterized by the use of bronze tools and weapons

phase3Production.content: The Uffington Horse is now believed to date from the late Bronze Age.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ***Neolithic: a period (in Britain c. 4,000 BCE – c. 2,500 BCE) that is significant for the spread of agricultural practices...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The later part of the Stone Age, when ground or polished stone weapons and implements prevailed

phase3Production.content: Farming began to spread across Europe during the Neolithic period.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...significant for the spread of agricultural practices, and the use of stone tools

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'lan rộng' (spread) 'của các phương thức' (of... practices) 'nông nghiệp' (agricultural)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of farming methods becoming more common over a wider area
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự lan rộng của các phương thức nông nghiệp

phase3Production.content: The Neolithic revolution is defined by the spread of agricultural practices.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ****Celtic: an ancient people who migrated from Europe to Britain before the Romans

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Relating to the Celts or their languages, which constitute a branch of the Indo-European family

phase3Production.content: The horse was an important animal in Celtic mythology.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...who migrated from Europe to Britain before the Romans

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have moved from one region (Europe) to settle in another (Britain)

phase3Production.content: Many early human groups migrated from Africa to other parts of the world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...consisting of a long, sleek back...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A back that is extended in length and is smooth and elegant in shape

phase3Production.content: The racing car had a long, sleek back to improve its aerodynamics.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a streaming tail, and a bird-like beaked head.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A tail that flows or extends outwards in a long, continuous line, as if moved by wind

phase3Production.content: The comet was visible in the night sky with its long, streaming tail.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...which consists of more than 30 well-preserved burial mounds.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các gò mộ 'được bảo quản tốt' (well-preserved)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Kept in good condition over a long period of time

phase3Production.content: The museum contains many well-preserved artifacts from the Roman era.
